thread.title: Aussie stocks rally 1pc at open after strong US economic figures boost global markets
thread.title_full: Aussie stocks rally 1pc at open after strong US economic figures boost global markets | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The Advertiser

author: Mitchell Neems Reporter
title: Aussie stocks rally 1pc at open after strong US economic figures boost global markets
text:
THE Australian sharemarket opened one per cent higher, and is on track to close out the volatile week in positive territory, after strong economic data boosted global markets overnight.
At the 10.15am (AEST) official market open, the benchmark S & P/ASX200 index added 56.3 points, or 1.08 per cent, to 5289.6 points, while the broader All Ordinaries rose 57.1 points, or 1.09 per cent, to 5299.7 points.
CMC chief market analyst Ric Spooner said after another strong market open, investors are starting to wonder what the recent sell-off was all about, with another day of strong buying likely as bargain-hunters scramble to take advantage of what looks like a value opportunity.
"Concerns about a possible softening in China’s economic growth have been offset by news of a sharp upward adjustment in US second quarter GDP," he said.
The early rally was helped by a large jump in oil prices, which contributed to strong support for BHP Billiton.
"At the end of the day however, investors will also be conscious that short covering after a protracted down trend is likely to have turbo charged last night’s sharp gain in oil markets," Mr Spooner said.
Equities in Europe and on Wall Street climbed on revised US data showing stronger growth in the second quarter of 3.7 per cent, compared with the previous estimate of 2.3 per cent.
Locally, no major economic news is expected on Friday.
In equities news, Slater & Gordon, IOOF, Mayne Pharma, Regis Healthcare, and Woolworths all posted full-year results.
In Australia, the market on Thursday moved more than 1 per cent higher, helped by a rebound in key overseas markets.
The benchmark S & P/ASX200 index was up 60.5 points, or 1.2 per cent, at 5233.3 points.
The broader All Ordinaries index was up 63.7 points, also 1.2 per cent, at 5242.6 points.
 Aussie stocks climb 1pc at open
